newsitem.title: UK: INTERVIEW-Independent says profits buck trend.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW-Independent says profits buck trend.

text.p: Independent Insurance Group Plc said on Tuesday it had bucked the market trend by achieving continued growth and an increase in profits for 1996.
"The main feature of our results is they against the trend in the market," Independent's chief executive Michael Bright told Reuters after the group declared a 46 percent rise in pre-tax profits.
Pre-tax profits including realised investment gains rose to 52.0 million stg in 1996 from 35.5 million stg the previous year. Excluding realised investment gains pre-tax profits rose 21 percent.
